nodes.bodyText: @AjayJagan  this dropdown have to be created from the process definition nodes. We can retrieve that info accessing to runtime Rest endpoint  .../management/processes/{processId}/nodes. Here you are creating it from the process instance existing nodes
Could we mock the trigger component or do we need it fully rendered for the test?

nodes.bodyText: @AjayJagan this button only should be enabled when there is a node selected to avoid to handle that situation throwing an error message.

@AjayJagan here we can provide some instructions about how to proceed, something like
"Select a node from the process nodes list and click 'Trigger' to launch it manually."

@AjayJagan I see a lot of duplicated code in loading the wrapper with the triggerableNodes before each test, Maybe we can create a block to do that, and call before executing each test and try to avoid this dupplication. Could you take a look on this?
converted to a common function . Please have a look
@AjayJagan looks better to me now, thanks!
@AjayJagan  Just a small nitpick. Can we follow the same naming pattern as on other components "IOwnProps", just to maintain some uniformity among all the components?
